alert.note: Alert for Northeast Aroostook; Northwest Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 21 at 7:29PM EST until February 23 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM TUESDAY TO 7 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches, sleet accumulations of around three quarters of an inch and ice accumulations of a light glaze expected. * WHERE...Northwest Aroostook and Northeast Aroostook Counties. * WHEN...From 7 AM Tuesday to 7 AM EST Wednesday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning and evening commute. The cold wind chills as low as 20 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: A Winter Weather Advisory means that periods of snow, sleet or freezing rain will cause travel difficulties. Expect slippery roads and limited visibilities, and use caution while driving. The latest road conditions for Maine can be obtained by going to newengland511.org.
